definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: Once upon a barren moor there dwelt a bear, also a boar.
sentences.chinese: 从前，在一个贫瘠的荒野里住了一只熊和一只公野猪。

sentences.english: The former russian satellite now turn to the west for help.
sentences.chinese: 从前俄国的卫星国现在转向西方要求援助。

sentences.english: Once upon a time there was a doctor who was an expert at treating snakebites.
sentences.chinese: 从前有位医生，十分擅长治疗蛇毒。

sentences.english: There was a bear called Bonnie. Bonnie was three.
sentences.chinese: 从前有一只熊叫博妮，她三岁。

sentences.english: The underparts were white with heavy dark streaks down the front.
sentences.chinese: 腹部从前到后有深黑色的条纹。

sentences.english: Ya I remember I was really an awkward kid.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，记得我从前实在是个笨小孩。

sentences.english: She had seen the world and lived with great people and raised herself far beyond her original humble station.
sentences.chinese: 她见过了世面，结识了大人物，地位比从前高得多。

sentences.english: Once upon a time an emperor had a beautiful young sister.
sentences.chinese: 从前有个国王，他有个很漂亮的妹妹。

sentences.english: Once, a group of frogs lived in a little pond.
sentences.chinese: 从前，有一群青蛙居住在一个小池塘。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, there was a Queen whose surname was Ma.
sentences.chinese: 从前有个皇后姓马，她生活非常简朴。

sentences.english: That formerly how to pick, time flies straight forward.
sentences.chinese: 翀那段从前怎么去捡，光阴似箭一直向前。

sentences.english: Even today Nash sometimes hears the old voices.
sentences.chinese: 今天纳什还能常听到那些从前的幻音。

sentences.english: For an isolated system. You've seen this before, probably.
sentences.chinese: 对孤立系统，大家从前可能见过这个公式。

sentences.english: Now there were seven brothers among us.
sentences.chinese: 从前在我们这里，有弟兄七人。

sentences.english: Her mother used to keep track of every penny she spent.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲从前把自己所花的每一分钱都记下来。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, a family with surname "Duan" from Dali, Yunnan Province, set up a clan named "Qiangzhong" here.
sentences.chinese: 从前，大理段氏在这个地方建立了“强宗”部落。

definition: things change with the passage of time (idiom)
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to come and go/to have friendly relations with/in the past/previous
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
